caseName: Texas Dept. of Housing and Community Affairs v. Inclusive Communities Project, Inc.
caseNameFull: TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND COMMUNITY AFFAIRS, Et Al., Petitioners v. the INCLUSIVE COMMUNITIES PROJECT, INC., Et Al.
court: Supreme Court of the United States

opinions.snippet:
Justice KENNEDYdelivered the opinion of the Court.
The underlying dispute in this case concerns where housing for low-income persons should be constructed in Dallas, Texas-that is, whether the housing should be built in the inner city or in the suburbs. This dispute comes to the Court on a disparate-impact theory of liability. In contrast to a disparate-treatment case, where a "plaintiff must establish that the defendant had a dis

EDITH H. JONES, Circuit Judge:
This case, on review pursuant to Fed. Rule Civ. PROC. 23(f), implicates the standards and procedures used by district courts when considering certification of securities class actions dependent on the “fraud on the market” theory.
